p: Contact tracing data were collected in Ngorongoro and Serengeti Districts for every rabies case that was detected from January 2002 through December 2006 [19], [20]. Serengeti is inhabited by agro-pastoralist communities with relatively dense populations of domestic dogs (9.4 dogs/km 2). The Serengeti ecosystem is also home to abundant and diverse populations of wildlife. Ngorongoro is inhabited by pastoralist communities and low density domestic dog populations (1.4 dogs/km 2). We analyzed the two districts separately because of these distinctions and because of differences in the logistics for dog vaccination campaigns [21].
